front.title: Best Current Practice for Megaco-Sigtran Interaction in ISDN Access Gateways

abstract.t: A Media Gateway with ISDN terminations will use both Megaco [1] andSigtran protocols for communication with the Media GatewayController. In an ISDN Access Gateway the media carrying B-channelsare controlled by the Media Gateway Controller using Megaco, whilethe User-to-Network signalling running over the D-channels will berelayed to the Media Gateway Controller using Sigtran protocols (IUA[3] over SCTP [2]).At the moment, in the absence of appropriate specifications, theMegaco and Sigtran protocols may interact in different ways in theAccess Gateway, leaving room for non-interoperable solutions.This draft proposes a set of guidelines for the Megaco-Sigtraninterworking, documenting a best current practice for ISDN AccessGateways.
